utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Don’t do it. That one’s overripe.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Really? You can tell?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Trust me. This is the one. Sweet and firm.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: I like sweet. And I like firm.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahhh! What are you drinking? Toxic waste?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, he forgot it. Are you – are you sure?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, I’ve never felt better in my entire life. Water, lime juice, no solid food.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jenny and I are going to start our marriage perfectly cleansed.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: We’ve already made it a week. We only have three days to go.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t even believe you guys are already getting married on Sunday.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: I know. Isn’t that crazy? I better go. My mom is freaking out about place cards. See you there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you, sweetie. I love you.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: I love you more.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s not possible.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know, I know, I know. We’re nauseating.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I am looking forward to meeting some of Jenny’s sorority sisters. I’m about to show them some of New York’s finest.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, good. Then I guess you won’t care that Lanie’s bringing a plus one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um, I don’t know. She just RSVP’d plus one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How can – how can she already have a boyfriend? We just broke up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Espo. I’m going alone, so if the sorority sisters don’t work out I’ll dance with you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Esposito.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, Jenny tells me that you RSVP’d plus one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re bringing a date?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, she’s beautiful, she’s intelligent, she’s funny. The way she smiles at me sometimes just melts my heart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Alexis.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Guys. We got a fresh one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie. We got a jumper?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Judging by the impact, I’d say he came from one of those windows above the 7th floor. Ryan and Esposito are already in to find the room with the hotel staff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … he’s naked.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Perceptive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it is pretty cold out. If this were a suicide, wouldn’t you rather be warm and toasty on your way down to your certain, yet citrusy death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: If it were suicide would you really have these? Fingernail marks, only an hour old?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it looks like he did the deed before taking the dive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Last item on your bucket list?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Two hotel clerks saw a white lady with long red hair hurrying out after birthday suit hit the fruit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. See if you can get a better description from those clerks and let’s set up a canvass. We gotta find that woman.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Antonio, could you refrigerate these samples in the van, please?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is this the guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mr. Plus One.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett! Found the room. Eighth floor!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Music to set the mood by?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. And then there’s the lipstick on the pillow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Lanie was right about our victim getting lucky before he ran out of luck.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, our vic’s name is Michael Bailey. 28. Lives at West 93rd Street. And according to his business card, he’s a junior analyst at Global Twelve Consolidated in midtown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who booked the room?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Booked under Jane Eyre, paid with cash, no credit card on file.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Suggests premeditation. She knew she was going to kill him, so she booked the room anonymously.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but then why sleep with him? Why not just push him out the window?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because. She’s a black widow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Coldest hearted creature on Earth. She lures an unsuspecting male, takes him into her web, and then, the moment they culminate – as soon as he feels the ecstasy of achieving his biological destiny – she opens up her jaws and eats him alive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m glad I’m in a healthy relationship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet male black widow spiders think they’re in healthy relationships, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, black widow or not, I think I figured out how we can find her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bingo.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY FRANKLIN
utterance.content: Do you have any idea who I am? I’m a founding partner of Keller, Brawn and Franklin. I’m Franklin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I don’t care about your law firm. A man fell to his death tonight and fingerprints confirm that you were at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: No, I had nothing to do with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, maybe you can tell me why people saw you fleeing the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Franklin, evidence suggests that you and Michael –

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Michael?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - Bailey were romantically involved.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Michael who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This man.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: No, that’s not Michael. That’s Jake. That’s Jake Hendricks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that’s Michael Bailey.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: I think I would know who I was sleeping with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, apparently you don’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You think I should pull her phone records?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah, what’s the point? We already have her at the hotel with the victim.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not her. Lanie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m not going to go to your wedding without knowing who this guy is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jenny has to find out for the place cards. I’ll get you his name.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Because he told me his name was Jake. Um, he said that he flies in from Chicago to make sales calls for his family business. He was really sweet. I didn’t kill him. I was falling in love with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he fell pretty hard, too. So how long were the two of you dating?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Uh, well we … we actually, uh, just met tonight, at um, Wilmer’s Bar at around 7.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tonight? And you were already falling in love with him?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Look, I know – I know it sounds crazy, but it felt like one of those magical connections that you read about, you know? After we … you know… um, he started to get dizzy and sweaty, so he opened up a window to get some fresh air and he was leaning against the windowsill when suddenly … he just ..

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so you’re saying that he fell out the window and your first instinct wasn’t to call 911 but to run away?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: I knew how it would look. But I panicked and I made a really bad decision, but I swear, it was an accident.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It was not an accident.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can tell he was pushed?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I didn’t say he was pushed. Michael Bailey was poisoned with a lethal dose of colchicine. He was dead before he hit the fruit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Colchicine? Isn’t that a drug for rheumatism?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yes. Which Bailey does not have. But he had fifty times the normal dosage in his system. I’m putting the time of ingestion between 4 and 6PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is 45 minutes before Holly said she met him at Wilmer’s Bar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea how that drug was delivered?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It was in something he drank. I found lots of whey protein isolate in his stomach, along with chocolate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So a chocolate protein shake.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’d be sweet enough to mask the taste of the drug.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of sweet, who’s your date for Ryan’s wedding?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Took a shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Thanks, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: One more thing. I ran a DNA test just to confirm that Superman here had sex before dying –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s okay. Our suspect –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Let me finish. The test shows he had sex, all right. With two different women within hours of his death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You dog.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ms. Franklin, it – it seems that you weren’t the only woman that Mr. Bailey was, uh … with, in the hours prior to his death.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Um… what do you mean, with?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was there another woman in the hotel room with you?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: I didn’t think this could get any more humiliating.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was that a yes?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: No, Detective!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you. Oh, and you should know that our ME has been able to determine that Mr. Bailey was, uh … wearing a condom both times, so that’s …

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: That makes it all better.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Now I wish I pushed him!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hell hath no fury, all right, but I’m pretty sure she’s telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe. But let’s just confirm her alibi before releasing her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the meantime, we need to find out where Bailey was and who he was with between 4 and 6PM when he was poisoned.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. That is our kill zone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, so I can’t find any next of kin on the guy. Parents died years ago. There’s no siblings, no nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then everything Bailey told Holly about himself was a lie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe that was his shtick. In from out of town, family guy, own business, that’s how he got women into bed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whatever his reason for lying to Holly, I’m betting that our killer is whoever Bailey slept with earlier in the day. She got on to his philandering and got even.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Go through his phone records. We’ve got to find that other woman.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Good morning, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Darling, where’s your credit card?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I liked "good morning" better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me ask you two something. If you found out a man was cheating on you, how would you kill him?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Knife. To the heart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, what if you don’t have the stomach for that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Shoot him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t have the stomach for that, either.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What is wrong with our stomachs?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: There’s always poison.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: True. Watch him writhe. And suffer.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Die like the rodent he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. All these years writing about murderers, I had no idea I was living among them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of murder, what’s the credit card for?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, we’re going shopping to pick out my dress to be your date at Ryan’s wedding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s wrong with the ones you have?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling. Beauty does not happen by accident.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s why when it goes unappreciated by cheating scum, we want revenge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even their hypothetical fury is unnerving. William Congreve had it right when he talked about scorned women.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you haven’t heard what I would do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t think I ever want to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey guys. Any luck tracking down Bailey’s other woman?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A lot of luck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like the beginning of The Bachelor but without the appletinis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bailey was involved with all of them?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. And each of them thought that they were his one and only.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a lot of scorned women. And a lot of fury.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah … I don’t get it. How does an average looking guy with a dime a dozen analyst job end up dating all of these gorgeous women?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By lying to them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, he wasn’t lying to these women. At least not about who he was anyway. They all knew him by his real name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why would he tell Holly he’s Jake from Chicago?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was Bailey with any of those women between 4 and 6 yesterday?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So far, no. But they all deny knowing that he was even in the city. A month ago he told every one of them he was going to Europe for 6 weeks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A month ago? So why’d he come back early?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He never went. And as far as I can tell from his credit card use, he never even left New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why tell them that he was leaving? I mean, was that just a cowardly way of breaking up with them?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think there’s something else going on. I called the personnel department at Global Twelve Consolidated and they said he’s been on a leave of absence for the last month.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a big month. Taking a leave from work and your girlfriends.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And his apartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doorman at Bailey’s building said that for the past month he’s only spent a couple nights a week there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The past month?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. He wasn’t there at all yesterday, so it’s not where he was poisoned. And I looked in his dresser and I found this. Illinois driver’s license.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jake Hendricks, Chicago. That’s the name that he gave Holly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he is Jake Hendricks?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, he’s Mike Bailey. That’s a fake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He did not buy this on some street corner. This is government grade.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, right down to the security hologram. It’s like he was living undercover. And, I found this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s a lot of cake.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why do you have to call it cake? It’s – it’s money. It’s a lot of money. It’s about $60 grand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cash … fake ID… what the hell was Bailey in to?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something bigger than just lying about who he was just to get laid. Jake Hendricks has fake web search hits. Lives in Chicago. Works for the family business.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just like he told Holly Franklin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Family business has a fake website.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a pretty deep cover.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Our Don Juan is starting to look more like Jason Bourne.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. You guys get a hold of FBI and CIA and any other intelligence agencies. See if he’s one of theirs. C’mon Castle, let’s talk to Bailey’s boss at Global Twelve Consolidated. Find out why our vic took that leave of absence.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: You guys mind if we take a few minutes?

utterance.speaker: RON HILL
utterance.content: No problem. We’re still working up the financing terms on subordinated debt anyway.

utterance.speaker: AMY KEMP
utterance.content: Sure. It’s not like these negotiations are going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Mike was a junior analyst in our acquisition department. He was a good kid. Bright future.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I understand that he took a leave of absence a month ago. Did he give you a reason why?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Personal issues. He didn’t say why, but I could tell it was serious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you have no idea why he would have a fake ID and $60 thousand cash?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: No. But maybe it had something to do with that woman that tried to break into his office yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was that?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: I don’t know. She was gone before security got there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who reported it?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: I had stepped out of negotiations to go to the restroom and in the hallway I noticed a woman was trying to pick an office door lock using a wrench and an opened up paperclip. I assumed she had just locked herself out of her office and joked that a key would work better. Well, she was startled and shoved me over and made a dash for the stairwell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a good look at her?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Yeah. And I told security. She was exotic, 30-ish, dark wavy hair. She had on an overcoat but it was open and she was wearing a pin with the Star of David on it. I’m pretty sure it’s the insignia from El Al Airlines.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Name’s Colette Roth. She’s 27. She’s been an El Al flight attendant for three years making the Tel Aviv – JFK run twice a week.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Intel agencies used to use flight attendants as spies, didn’t they?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And get this. She’s former Israeli military.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mossad is famous for poisoning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, big time. Castle might not be that far off with his Jason Bourne theory.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uniforms are tracking her down now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah … Jenny just texted me Lanie’s plus one. Name is Toby Lang.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? Toby Lang. All right. Let’s check this punk out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Doctor Toby Lang? Guy’s the chief administrator at Saint Samuel’s Hospital. Big job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Lanie did her residency there, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Good looking guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Played college hoops at Kentucky, ground breaking cancer researcher … are you kidding me? Put me down for plus one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jenny already did the tables.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What about her sorority sisters?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dude. I’m not showing up solo when she’s bringing Captain America over here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll talk to Jenny. But her mom is going to need a name for that place card.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Esposito. Copy that. Colette Roth just checked in for a flight at JFK. Unis are picking her up now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: COLETTE ROTH
utterance.content: I am not a spy. I’m a flight attendant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, maybe you can explain your relationship with Michael Bailey.

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: We were soul mates.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then. I’m sure you’ll be able to tell us where the two of you were yesterday between the hours of 4 and 6PM.

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: I was outside his apartment waiting for him. But he never came.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You had a very busy day yesterday. You were seen trying to break into his office just hours before that.

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: I was hoping to find some sort of clue. Something that might lead me to his enemies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His enemies?

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: Michael was a hunted man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hunted? By who?

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: I don’t know. I just know he was in trouble. Four weeks ago, he said he was going to Europe, but I kept seeing him in the city. And he kept pretending not to notice me. So I staked out his apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you stalked him?

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: Staked, stalked … what’s the difference? I was looking out for him. But he wasn’t coming home. Then a few days ago I finally confronted him. He said he couldn’t talk, but he told me to meet him the next day and he’d explain everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess. That was the last time that you saw him?

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: No. We met the next day. But before he could tell me what was going on, this car came out of nowhere and they were on us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: COLETTE
utterance.content: Ruffians. In ski masks. They grabbed him and threw him in the back. I fought with all of my strength, but it was in vain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bet you did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you report this?

utterance.speaker: COLETTE

utterance.content: Can’t you see it? Bailey is in covert ops. They placed him at a giant multinational company – Global Twelve Consolidated – as a cover. Then, a month ago they activate him. utterance.content: Did you get an address?

utterance.content: Sure did.

utterance.content: All right. Let’s go. Where’s Espo?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: In the break room, trying to score his plus one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, let’s go!

utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: MAX
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.content: Oh, yeah. "Bolero" increases the chances of closing the deal by 12%.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, assuming you are telling the truth, you were with Mike the night before he was killed. Did he tell you what he was up to?

utterance.content: So we do our usual couple laps of recon. There’s actually some pretty decent MILFs. And I think Mike’s just expanding his palate, right?

utterance.content: No. Instead he finds this one mark, like ugh, nothing special, and plants his flag.

utterance.content: ‘Cause you’re so ethical.

utterance.content: No. They’re just trouble. But he doesn’t care. He’s all in on her.

utterance.content: So you think he went to this bar for this particular woman. Like he was targeting her?

utterance.speaker: PABLO
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.content: Nah, total red light. Gate’s down, train’s coming, time to move on. But not Mike. Not on this night.

utterance.content: Authorizing, huh?

utterance.content: Make it seem like the last thing on his mind is hooking up. Nah. He just finds her interesting and wants to talk.

utterance.content: But she doesn’t bite. So he tries an m-swig. Tells her he knows this girl is cheating on his friend. Should he tell his friend?

utterance.speaker: MAX
utterance.content: ‘Cause women love to give advice. But she’s still giving him the Heisman, so he tries a butter job.

utterance.content: And that’s when he started getting traction. Immediately follows with a yank-and-chain reversal, sees he’s got her on the hook –

utterance.content: So he goes right for the Bailey ultimatum. Boom! Signature move. Says he has to leave, forcing the mark to make a quick decision whether to go with you or not.

utterance.content: And what did she do?

utterance.speaker: PABLO
utterance.content: Next thing you know, two of them are walking on their way out of there. You know, you have some beautiful eyes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: PABLO
utterance.content: What? It’s a numbers game. I strike out 90% of the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thus restoring my faith in my gender. So, this mark that he was working. Does she have a name?

utterance.speaker: PABLO
utterance.content: Lisa. The greatest pickup I have ever seen. It’s a damn shame that she’ll never make it into Mike’s ledger.

utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.content: Is there a Lisa in there from two days ago?

utterance.content: Hey. So our friends Max and Pablo just alibied out. They were both at work when Mike was poisoned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Limber Lucy. And boy is she ever.

utterance.content: I don’t know what this dude Bailey was in to, but whatever it was he had it going on.

utterance.content: Really? This impresses you? These women are pathetic for falling for this guy and Bailey? Bailey was just a con man and a liar.

utterance.content: Thank you. At least there is one real man amongst us. Ryan, why don’t you take The Situation down to The Magic Bottle and see if we can get an ID on Lisa. And find out why Bailey might have been targeting her.

utterance.content: Oh my gosh, that’s Jenny.

utterance.content: Give me a sec.

utterance.content: I bank.

utterance.content: Well, you are on your own. I’m getting married on Sunday.

utterance.content: Exactly. So this is your last chance to be my wingman. Help me get a plus one. I’m going to try an m-swig.

utterance.content: Dude, you can’t be serious.

utterance.content: So not only is Lisa Hill married, she is also an heiress. Daughter to Stephanie Dashby.

utterance.content: Bailey was hunting big game. He knew he couldn’t close the deal as a junior analyst, that’s why he used the alias with her. The same way he used it with big shot lawyer Holly Franklin.

utterance.content: Yeah well, according to her maid, Lisa Hill packed up and left her apartment for her house in Montauk at 6:30PM.

utterance.content: Half an hour after our kill zone.

utterance.content: Plus she also had easy access to our poison. Her sister owns a drug company that manufactures it.

utterance.content: This is about the money. Bailey only used the Jake identity with Holly and Lisa. They’re both rich.

utterance.content: So what are you thinking? An extortion plot?

utterance.content: Bricks of cash probably from previous successes.

utterance.content: So. What are we going to do?

utterance.content: About what?

utterance.content: What? Why? Castle, if we were getting married would you want to know about all the guys that I’ve slept with?

utterance.content: So … who was the wingman? The grandpa or the kid?

utterance.content: Dad. They were total gentlemen. They even invited us to their family’s annual charity event. A private concert with Lady Gaga.

utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.content: He was flaunting that donut!

utterance.content: No, no. I – I’m fine. I – I’m sorry, everybody. Sorry, bro.

utterance.content: Yeah, we tracked her down at a spa in Montauk.

utterance.content: Yeah, she’s going from mud wrap to murder rap. Exfoliation to interrogation. Manicure to manacles. Shiatsu to …

utterance.content: So Bailey was engaged in covert ops. He targeted Ron Hill’s wife Lisa and slept with her in order to steal KPW corporate secrets.

utterance.content: That’s espionage.

utterance.content: Ah, sure. Ron got screwed on the deal. And his wife got screwed. Boy, if anyone ever had a motive for murder it was Ron Hill.

utterance.content: Yeah, except he was in negotiations during the poisoning kill zone and his wife Lisa alibi’d too.

utterance.content: I’ve been looking at the KPW deal. Turns out they’re represented by Keller, Brawn and Franklin. Guess who their lead attorney is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Holly Franklin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep, Miss No-Tell-Hotel herself. The only reason you guys didn’t run into her at Global Twelve Consolidated was that we were still holding her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That explains the Lisa and Holly connection.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it begs the question – how many other women did Bailey target in this little sexpionage scheme?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you guys get a list of all the people at KPW that were working the sale, including the banking and legal teams.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no way that Bailey was working this alone. He’s too junior.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And besides, he was on leave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who authorized the leave?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Yes, I authorized his leave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You gave him a fake ID and cash bonuses, Mr. Harris.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: I already told you, I don’t know anything about that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well how about this? Bailey slept with Holly Franklin and Ron Hill’s wife Lisa to steal KPW secrets for your negotiation. Did you know about that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon Harris. This couldn’t be Bailey’s idea. You’re his boss. And you’re Global Twelve Consolidated’s lead negotiator for the KPW deal. So … how did it start? Did you happen to see Bailey out one night at some bar? Working his magic? Realize that you could use his ability to your advantage?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: This is nothing but wild speculation. You have no proof whatsoever of any wrongdoing on my part or Global Twelve.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I don’t care about corporate malfeasance. I want Michael Bailey’s killer.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: And how do you think I can help?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You tell me where he’s been staying for the past month. Tell me who else was targeted and who he was with the day he was killed.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Unless you’re actually going to charge me with something? I’m leaving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There are more than 300 female executives at KPW. Bailey could have targeted any one of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not to mention any of the women at the law firm and the investment bank also working on the deal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We still have no idea where he was poisoned.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any luck?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, there’s too big a pool of possible marks that Bailey could have slept with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, uh … speaking of that. You know, Ryan’s my boy. So I gotta tell him about Jenny and Bailey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You only told me I couldn’t tell Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look Espo, I appreciate your point of view, but the guy hasn’t eaten in a week and a half, and after that donut incident I don’t –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll just take these back to my desk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sit down, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why do you guys look so serious?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You should … eat something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. You look hungry. You’ve got the posture of a feral cat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guys, I made a sacred vow to the woman I love – Is that mushu pork?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes. And it is delicious. C’mon bro. Just eat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re not kidding about this mushu pork. C’mon!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pass the spring rolls, please?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. So … you know how we all love Jenny, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, what about her?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, it’s just that, uh … that ledger of Bailey’s?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, is she in that? I’ve been meaning to ask, but I have been having these – these memory lapses. Mmm… pass the fried rice?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’ve known all along?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No… I – I was telling Jenny about Javi’s antics last night and we got to talking about the case. She told me she met Bailey at a bar a month or so after we started up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She told you about that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. She had no idea he was some kind of professional pickup artist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you’re not upset at all?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I mean – it’s not like we were exclusive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is that Mongolian beef? Oh man.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER DI
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks, Di. Oh, get this. So I’ve been trying to figure out where Bailey might have been staying for the past month, and when we got on to his corporate spying for Global Twelve Consolidated I looked into their corporate housing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s … a great idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Why didn’t I think of that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Turns out Mike Bailey has been checked into The Oaks on Park Avenue for the last month under his alias Jake Hendricks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, what are you sitting around for?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh! Do you mind if I take the spareribs?

utterance.speaker: OAKS MANAGER
utterance.content: You’re welcome to look, but we got the call yesterday that Mr. Hendricks wasn’t coming back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What did you do with all his stuff?

utterance.speaker: OAKS MANAGER
utterance.content: Per his company’s instructions we gave his clothes and personal belongings to Goodwill. And the place has been scrubbed, bedding laundered.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Javier, check this out. Chocolate Blast. It’s a protein shake. Made with whey protein isolate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You always stock this drink?

utterance.speaker: OAKS MANAGER
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s all standard.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s exactly what Lanie said that Bailey had in his system that delivered the colchicine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is where he was poisoned, bro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like we found the murder weapon. Lanie says that the chocolate shake from The Oaks is a perfect match for the contents of Bailey’s stomach. It’s what delivered the lethal dose of colchicine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So the doorman at The Oaks confirms that Bailey was there during the whole poison time window. He asked not to be disturbed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I bet. Because sexpionage can be so much more demanding than espionage.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I’m guessing he had a visitor?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep. Someone that had been there a few times before. Security cam photo capture.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: RON HILL
utterance.content: If we could focus on the third quarter I believe that would be the most productive way to move forward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Sorry to interrupt again.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: What’s up, Seth?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Nothing. Nothing at all. Look, Detective, I have already told you everything that I know about Michael Bailey. Now please, leave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we’re not here for you, Mr. Harris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That would be the SEC, soon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Today we are here for a woman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone who works for KPW and also knew Michael Bailey. Your COO, Amy Kemp. You’re under arrest for the murder of Michael Bailey.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Pleasure doing business with you, Seth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She said killing him was just business. He had to die to protect the corporate secrets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess the fact that he won’t be around to dupe other women was an added benefit. Bailey worked her like all the other women. Made her feel special, got her to fall for him, but somewhere along the way she figured out what he was up to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m just glad I’m out of the game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh… the games are only beginning for you, my friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, so what’s up with your plus one?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh… it’s on. It’s all I’m sayin’.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lanie, hey.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hello, Javier. This is Toby.

utterance.speaker: TOBY
utterance.content: Pleased to meet you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. You too. This is Jody.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Pleasure. Excuse me, I need to find the ladies' room.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: TOBY
utterance.content: Uh, you two talk. I’ll get us seats.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Thank you, Toby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Toby, huh?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What do you mean, ‘Toby, huh’?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know, you tell me.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You and I broke up two months ago, so unless you thought I joined a convent, you need to take a step back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So are you two serious now?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re serious. About dancing. That’s why his boyfriend let me borrow him. Besides, I figured I’d need somebody to keep me company while you flirted with Jenny’s sorority sisters.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Toby’s … boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And I seem to recall you here with the center for the New York Liberty.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s my cousin. I heard you were coming with a date so I thought I had to have somebody … You look great, you know.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can I show you to your seat?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That would be nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You look like a lost puppy. Where’s your date?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At a Lady Gaga concert with a teenage boy. How do I compete with that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, me too. I hate going to weddings alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe we could be each other’s plus one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah! And then avoid the stigma of sitting at the singles table. Yes, that would be nice. I would like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, look at him. He looks so happy!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! Oh, I’m so glad you’re here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where else were we gonna be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You look fantastic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we clean up pretty nice, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh Jenny, you look amazing.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Thank you, Rick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no… you can’t see her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kevin, you are a lucky man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t I know it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ready, bro?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’re gonna see you in there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I gotta say. I kind of envy him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, who knows, Castle. Maybe third time’s a charm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Could be. Shall we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
